content: directions for working around flap till you reach the chain slip_stitch into base of chain attach yarn at center bottom of purse and chain 30 fasten_off and weave attaching end into purse bottom wash the purse in the washing machine in hot water cold rinse is okay but the hot water is necessary for felt to be made with gentle laundry detergent and a towel or other item to rub against your purse as the washer works after washing the purse will have shrunk and the fabric will have become dense and solid if it seems solid enough to you let it air dry if you can still see holes between the stitches put it in the dryer on a hot setting with other items this should complete the felting process if not repeat the wash and dry cycles after felting you can cut off your yarn tails with scissors being careful not to cut into the purse fabric felt does not ravel so your work is safe use the two chains to tie your purse shut to make the larger purse you ll need the same hook and about 3 ounces of wool worsted weight yarn start with 35 stitches in your beginning chain work 32 row of single_crochet stitches then fold and crochet together as with the small purse attach yarn at one side and make 50 chains then attach with a slip_stitch at the other side of the purse see photo to form the handle attach yarn in the center of the front flap and work 20 chains joining with a slip_stitch so the end meets the beginning to form button loop wash and dry on hot settings as for the small purse to felt after felting sew a button to the front so that it will meet the button loop cut off all yarn ends
